questions.text: Which of the following characteristics is shared by simple diffusion of Oxygen and facilitated diffusion of glucose?

options.label: D
options.text: Is inhibited by the presence of galactose

questions.correct_answer: A. Occurs down an electrochemical gradient

questions.text: During the upstroke of the nerve action potential

options.label: A
options.text: There is net outward current and the cell interior becomes more negative

options.label: B
options.text: There is net outward current and the cell interior becomes less negative

options.label: C
options.text: There is net inward current and the cell interior becomes more negative

options.label: D
options.text: There is net inward current and the cell interior becomes less negative

questions.correct_answer: D. There is net inward current and the cell interior becomes less negative

questions.text: The correct temporal sequence for events at the neuromuscular junction is

options.label: A
options.text: Action potential in the motor nerve; depolarization of the muscle end plate; uptake of Ca 2+ into the presynaptic nerve terminal

options.label: B
options.text: Uptake of Ca 2+ into the presynaptic terminal; release of acetylcholine (ACh); depolarization of the muscle end plate

options.label: C
options.text: Release of ACh; action potential in the motor nerve; action potential in the muscle

options.label: D
options.text: Uptake of Ca 2+ into the motor end plate; action potential in the motor end plate; action potential in the muscle

questions.correct_answer: B. Uptake of Ca 2+ into the presynaptic terminal; release of acetylcholine (ACh); depolarization of the muscle end plate

questions.text: Which characteristic or component is shared by skeletal muscle and smooth muscle?

options.label: A
options.text: Thick and thin filaments arranged in sarcomeres

options.label: C
options.text: Elevation of intracellular [Ca 2+ ] for excitation–contraction coupling

options.label: D
options.text: Spontaneous depolarization of the membrane potential

questions.correct_answer: C. Elevation of intracellular [Ca 2+ ] for excitation–contraction coupling

questions.text: Repeated stimulation of a skeletal muscle fiber causes a sustained contraction (tetanus). Accumulation of which solute in intracellular fluid is responsible for the tetanus?
questions.correct_answer: D. Ca 2+

questions.text: A 42-year-old man with myasthenia gravis notes increased muscle strength when he is treated with an acetylcholinesterase (AChE) inhibitor. The basis for his improvement is increase in

options.label: A
options.text: Amount of acetylcholine (ACh) released from motor nerves

options.label: B
options.text: Levels of ACh at the muscle end plates

options.label: C
options.text: Number of ACh receptors on the muscle end plates

options.label: D
options.text: Amount of norepinephrine released from motor nerves

questions.correct_answer: B. Levels of ACh at the muscle end plates

questions.text: During a nerve action potential, a stimulus is delivered as indicated by the arrow shown in the following figure. In response to the stimulus, a second action potential

options.label: C
options.text: Of normal magnitude will occur but will be delayed

questions.correct_answer: D. Will not occur

questions.text: A 66-year-old man with chronic hypertension is treated with prazosin by his physician. The treatment successfully decreases his blood pressure to within the normal range. What is the mechanism of the drug’s action?

options.label: A
options.text: Inhibition of a1 receptors in vascular smooth muscle

options.label: B
options.text: Inhibition of β2 receptors in the vascular smooth muscle

options.label: C
options.text: Stimulation of muscarinic receptors in the Ventricular muscle

options.label: D
options.text: Stimulation of nicotinic receptors in the SA node

questions.correct_answer: A. Inhibition of a1 receptors in vascular smooth muscle

questions.text: Which of the following is a property of C fibers?

options.label: A
options.text: Have the slowest conduction velocity of any nerve fiber type

options.label: B
options.text: Have the largest diameter of any nerve fiber type

options.label: C
options.text: Are afferent nerves from muscle spindles

options.label: D
options.text: Are afferent nerves from Golgi tendon organs

questions.correct_answer: A. Have the slowest conduction velocity of any nerve fiber type

questions.text: When compared with the cones of the retina, the rods

options.label: A
options.text: Are more sensitive to low-intensity light

options.label: B
options.text: Adapt to darkness before the cones

options.label: C
options.text: Are most highly concentrated on the fovea

options.label: D
options.text: Are primarily involved in color vision

questions.correct_answer: A. Are more sensitive to low-intensity light

questions.text: Which of the following statements best describes the basilar membrane of the organ of Corti?

options.label: A
options.text: The apex responds better to low frequencies than the base does

options.label: B
options.text: The base is wider than the apex

options.label: C
options.text: The base is more compliant than the apex

options.label: D
options.text: High frequencies produce maximal displacement of the basilar membrane near the helicotrema

questions.correct_answer: A. The apex responds better to low frequencies than the base does

questions.text: Which reflex is responsible for monosynaptic excitation of ipsilateral homonymous muscle?
questions.correct_answer: A. Stretch reflex (myotatic)

questions.text: Which of the following parts of the body has cortical motoneurons with the largest representation on the primary motor cortex (area 4)?
questions.correct_answer: C. Fingers

questions.text: A 53-year-old woman is found, by arteriography, to have 50% narrowing of her left renal artery. What is the expected change in blood flow through the stenotic artery?
questions.correct_answer: D. Decrease to 1⁄16

questions.text: When a person moves from a supine position to a standing position, which of the following compensatory changes occurs?
questions.correct_answer: B. Increased contractility

questions.text: At which site is systolic blood pressure the highest?
questions.correct_answer: D. Renal artery

questions.text: The tendency for blood flow to be turbulent is increased by

options.label: C
options.text: Partial occlusion of a blood vessel

questions.correct_answer: C. Partial occlusion of a blood vessel

questions.text: During exercise, total peripheral resistance (TPR) decreases because of the effect of

options.label: A
options.text: The sympathetic nervous system on splanchnic arterioles

options.label: B
options.text: The parasympathetic nervous system on skeletal muscle arterioles

options.label: C
options.text: Local metabolites on skeletal muscle arterioles

questions.correct_answer: C. Local metabolites on skeletal muscle arterioles

questions.text: The greatest pressure decrease in the circulation occurs across the arterioles because

options.label: A
options.text: They have the greatest surface area

options.label: B
options.text: They have the greatest cross-sectional area

options.label: C
options.text: The velocity of blood flow through them is the highest

questions.correct_answer: D. They have the greatest resistance

questions.text: In the sinoatrial (SA) node, phase 4 depolarization (pacemaker potential) is attributable to
questions.correct_answer: B. An increase in Na + conductance

questions.text: Myocardial contractility is best correlated with the intracellular concentration of
questions.correct_answer: C. Ca 2+

questions.text: Which of the following lung volumes or capacities can be measured by spirometry?
questions.correct_answer: D. Vital capacity (VC)

questions.text: An infant born prematurely in gestational week 25 has neonatal respiratory distress syndrome. Which of the following would be expected in this infant?
questions.correct_answer: B. Collapse of the small alveoli

questions.text: In which vascular bed does hypoxia cause vasoconstriction?
questions.correct_answer: B. Pulmonary

questions.text: Which of the following is true during inspiration?

options.label: B
options.text: The volume in the lungs is less than the functional residual capacity (FRC)

options.label: D
options.text: Intrapleural pressure is more negative than it is during expiration

questions.correct_answer: D. Intrapleural pressure is more negative than it is during expiration

questions.text: Which volume remains in the lungs after a tidal volume (VT) is expired?
questions.correct_answer: D. Functional residual capacity (FRC)

questions.text: When a person is standing, blood flow in the lungs is

options.label: A
options.text: Equal at the apex and the base

options.label: B
options.text: Highest at the apex owing to the effects of gravity on arterial pressure

options.label: C
options.text: Highest at the base because that is where the difference between arterial and venous pressure is greatest

options.label: D
options.text: Lowest at the base because that is where alveolar pressure is greater than arterial pressure

questions.correct_answer: C. Highest at the base because that is where the difference between arterial and venous pressure is greatest

questions.text: A 49-year-old man has a pulmonary embolism that completely blocks blood flow to his left lung. As a result, which of the following will occur?

options.label: A
options.text: Ventilation/perfusion (V/Q) ratio in the left lung will be zero

options.label: B
options.text: Systemic arterial PO2 will be elevated

options.label: C
options.text: V/Q ratio in the left lung will be lower than in the right lung

options.label: D
options.text: Alveolar PO2 in the left lung will be approximately equal to the PO2 in inspired air

questions.correct_answer: D. Alveolar PO2 in the left lung will be approximately equal to the PO2 in inspired air

questions.text: In the hemoglobin–O2 dissociation curves shown below, the shift from curve A to curve B could be caused by
questions.correct_answer: C. Strenuous exercise

questions.text: Compared with the apex of the lung, the base of the lung has
questions.correct_answer: B. A higher pulmonary capillary PCO2

questions.text: In the transport of CO 2 from the tissues to the lungs, which of the following occurs in venous blood?

options.label: A
options.text: Conversion of CO 2 and H 2 O to H + and HCO 3 - in the red blood cells (RBCs)

options.label: C
options.text: Shifting of HCO 3 − into the RBCs from plasma in exchange for Cl −

questions.correct_answer: A. Conversion of CO 2 and H 2 O to H + and HCO 3 - in the red blood cells (RBCs)

questions.text: Which of the following is the site of secretion of intrinsic factor?
questions.correct_answer: B. Gastric fundus

questions.text: Vibrio cholerae causes diarrhea because it

options.label: A
options.text: Increases HCO 3 − secretory channels in intestinal epithelial cells

options.label: B
options.text: Increases Cl − secretory channels in crypt cells

options.label: C
options.text: Prevents the absorption of glucose and causes water to be retained in the intestinal lumen isosmotically

options.label: D
options.text: Inhibits cyclic adenosine monophosphate (cAMP) production in intestinal epithelial cells

questions.correct_answer: B. Increases Cl − secretory channels in crypt cells

questions.text: Which of the following is transported in intestinal epithelial cells by a Na+- dependent cotransport process?
questions.correct_answer: D. Alanine

questions.text: Cholecystokinin (CCK) inhibits
questions.correct_answer: A. Gastric emptying

questions.text: Which of the following hormones acts on its target tissues by a steroid hormone mechanism of action?

options.label: C
options.text: Antidiuretic hormone (ADH) on the collecting duct

questions.correct_answer: A. Thyroid hormone

questions.text: Which of the following substances is derived from proopiomelanocortin (POMC)?
questions.correct_answer: A. Adrenocorticotropic hormone (ACTH)

questions.text: Macula Densa is formed by
questions.correct_answer: C. DCT

questions.text: Arrange the following substances in the order of maximum filterability across glomerular filtration membrane
questions.correct_answer: D. Polycations, Neutral, Polyanions

questions.text: Which part of renal tubule is least permeable to water?
questions.correct_answer: C. Thick Ascending limb
